source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第十二
translation: Fobenxing ji jing, vol. 12

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏闍那崛多譯
translation: Translated by the Tripiṭaka of India, translated by Jñānagupta

source_sentence: 遊戲觀矚品第十二
translation: The Twelfth Chapter of the Contemplation of Enjoyment

source_sentence: 「爾時，太子生長王宮，孩童之時，遊戲未學，年滿八歲，出閤詣師，
translation: “At that time the prince grew up in the royal palace. As a child, he played and did not learn but when he was eight years old he went out of his parents’ womb to visit their teachers.

source_sentence: 入於學堂。
translation: He entered the study hall.

source_sentence: 從毘奢蜜及忍天所，二大尊邊，受讀諸書，并一切論，兵戎雜術，經歷四年，
translation: In the course of four years he came from Vaiśāmī and Kṣubhavyūha to the place where the two great honored ones were staying. He read all the books and all the treatises, as well as military doctrines and miscellaneous rules of warfare.

source_sentence: 至十二時，種種技能，遍皆涉獵。
translation: At twelve o'clock, he had various skills and went hunting all over.

source_sentence: 既通達已，隨順世間，悅目適心，縱情放蕩，馳逐聲色。
translation: Having comprehended it, he follows the world, pleases the eyes and hearts with delight, indulges in carelessness of mind, and chases after sound and form.

source_sentence: 曾於一時，在勤劬園，遨遊射戲，自餘五百諸釋種童，亦各在其自己園內，
translation: At one time the Master was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada’s pleasure park, playing and frolicking. The other five hundred children of the Śākya clan were also in their own park.

source_sentence: 優遊嬉戲。
translation: He's fond of traveling and playing.

source_sentence: 時有群鴈，行飛虛空，是時童子提婆達多，彎弓而射，即著一鴈。
translation: At the time, there were a group of monks who flew up into the sky. The boy Devadatta then drew his bow and fired, and he caught a hook.

source_sentence: 其鴈被射，帶箭遂墮悉達園中。
translation: The arrow fell into the garden of Siddhârtha, carrying an arrow.

source_sentence: 時太子見彼鴈帶箭被傷墮地，見已兩手安徐捧取，取已加趺，安鴈膝上，
translation: When the prince saw that coarse arrow he wound and fell to the ground. Seeing it, he held it gently in both hands, drew it, touched it, and placed it on his knees.

source_sentence: 以妙滑澤柔潤水波，萬字輪文，福德之手，細軟猶如芭蕉嫩葉，左手擎持，
translation: His hand of blessedness was as fine and soft as the tender leaves of a plantain tree, held up in his left hand.

source_sentence: 右手拔箭，即以酥蜜，封於其瘡。
translation: In his right hand, he pulls out an arrow and seals the sores with butter and honey.

source_sentence: 是時提婆達多童子，遣使人來語太子言：『我射一鴈，墮汝園中，宜速付來，
translation: Devadatta then sent an envoy to the prince, saying, “I will shoot a arrow and fall into your garden.

source_sentence: 不得留彼。』
translation: They can't stay there.'

source_sentence: 是時太子，報使人言：『鴈若命終，即當還汝；
translation: The prince then reported to the messengers, saying: I am afraid if my life ends, I will return to you.

source_sentence: 若不死者，終不可得。』
translation: If someone doesn't die, they'll never attain it.'

source_sentence: 時提婆達多，復更重遣使人語言：『若死若活，決須相還，我手於先，
translation: Devadatta then again sent another messenger, saying, 'If you die or live, you must surely return.

source_sentence: 善巧射得，遇墮落彼，云何忽留？』
translation: If you skillfully shoot and fall into them, why do you suddenly stay there?'

source_sentence: 太子報言：『我已於先攝受此鴈。
translation: The prince replied, 'I've previously accepted this dispute.

source_sentence: 所以然者，自我發於菩提心來，我皆攝受一切眾生，況復此鴈而不屬我。』
translation: That's why I self-arouse the mind of enlightenment, and I take care of all sentient beings, so why wouldn't this dispute belong to me?'

source_sentence: 以是因緣，即便相競，集聚諸釋宿老智人，判決此事。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, they even competed with each other, gathering together the Śākyas, the elders, and the wise men to judge this matter.

source_sentence: 是時有一淨居諸天，變身化作老宿長者，入釋會所，而作是言：『誰養育者？
translation: At the time, there were some purely resident gods who transformed themselves into old men and elders and entered the assembly hall, saying, 'Who will nurture them?'

source_sentence: 即是攝受。
translation: That's to say, it's taking in.

source_sentence: 射著之者，即是放捨。』
translation: To shoot it is to abandon it.'

source_sentence: 時彼諸釋宿老諸人，一時印可，高聲唱云：『如是如是，如仁者言。』
translation: Those Śākyamunis and elders then sealed their approval at once, shouted in a loud voice, 'So it is, so it is, as you say, sir.'

source_sentence: 此是提婆達多童子，共於太子，最初搆結怨讎因緣。
translation: This is the cause and condition for Devadatta's association with the prince, who initially created a grudge against him.

source_sentence: 「復有一時，其淨飯王，共多釋種諸童子輩，并將太子，出外野遊，觀看田種。
translation: Again, there was another time when King Śuddhodana went out into the wilderness to look at the fields and seeds with a large group of children of the Śākya clan.

source_sentence: 時彼地內所有作人，赤體辛勤而事耕墾，以牛縻繫，彼犁[輻-田+冏]端，
translation: At the time, all the artisans in that land were red-bodied and diligently engaged in plowing and cultivating. They were bound by an ox cart.

source_sentence: 牛若行遲時時搖掣，日長天熱，喘嚇汗流，人牛並皆困乏飢渴。
translation: When the cow walks slowly, it shakes and trembles from time to time. The days grow longer and the sky becomes hot day by day, panting and sweating heavily. All the people and animals are hungry and thirsty.

source_sentence: 又復身體羸瘦連骸，而彼犁傷土墢之下，皆有虫出。
translation: Again, his body was weak and thin, with a series of skeletons, and the plow wounded the earth beneath it, and all the insects emerged.

source_sentence: 人犁過後，時諸鳥雀，競飛下來，食此虫豸。
translation: After the human plow passed, birds and birds rushed up and down to feed on this insect.

source_sentence: 太子覩茲犁牛疲頓，兼被鞭撻，犁[輻-田+冏]研領，鞅繩勒咽，血出下流，
translation: The prince was exhausted and tormented by the pain of being whipped and beaten, while the ox-drawn plow [cakravartin] climbed onto his chest with a rope around its neck. His blood flowed downward into the stream.

source_sentence: 傷破皮肉。
translation: It hurts and breaks skin and flesh.

source_sentence: 復見犁人，被日炙背，裸露赤體，塵土坌身，烏鳥飛來，爭拾蟲食。
translation: Again, he saw that the plowman was sun- scorched on his back, bare and red in color, covered with dirt and dirt. A crow came flying up to feed on the insects.

source_sentence: 太子見已，起大憂愁。
translation: Seeing this, the prince became greatly distressed.

source_sentence: 譬如有人見家親族被繫縛時，生大憂愁，太子憐愍彼諸眾等，亦復如是。
translation: It's like a person who sees their family and relatives bound and becomes greatly distressed, and the prince pitys them and so forth, just as he does.

source_sentence: 見是事已，起大慈悲，即從馬王揵陟上下，下已安庠經行，思念諸眾生等，
translation: Having seen these things, he arouses great compassion and thinks of the sentient beings who have been walking up and down from the carriage drawn by the king of horses.

source_sentence: 有如是事，即復唱言：『嗚呼嗚呼！
translation: When there's such a thing, he then again calls out, 'Ahoy, ahoy!

source_sentence: 世間眾生，極受諸苦，所謂生老及以病死，兼復受於種種苦惱，展轉其中，
translation: Sentient beings in the world suffer extreme pain. Birth, old age, sickness, and death are combined with various kinds of pain and suffering that continue to afflict them one after another.

source_sentence: 不能得離。
translation: They can't be freed.

source_sentence: 云何不求捨是諸苦？
translation: How is it that they don't seek equanimity as suffering?

source_sentence: 云何不求厭苦寂智？
translation: How is it that they don't seek the knowledge of disillusionment with suffering and quiescence?

source_sentence: 云何不念免脫生老病死苦因？
translation: How is it that they aren't mindful of the causes of suffering from birth, old age, illness, and death?

source_sentence: 我今於何得空閑處，思惟如是諸苦惱事？』
translation: Where can I now get an empty place to contemplate such painful and distressing things?'

source_sentence: 「時淨飯王觀田作已，共諸童子還入一園。
translation: After King Śuddhodana had finished observing the field, he returned to a park with the children.

source_sentence: 是時太子，安庠矚眄，處處經行，欲求寂靜。
translation: At the time, the prince was calm and attentive, walking around everywhere in order to seek quiescence.

source_sentence: 忽見一處有閻浮樹，條幹滑澤，端正可憐，欝蓊扶疎，人所樂見。
translation: Suddenly he saw that there was a Jambudvīpa tree in a place where the branches and trunks of the trees were straight and smooth, pleasing to the sight.

source_sentence: 見已即語諸左右言：『汝等諸人！
translation: Seeing them, he said to his left and right, 'You people!

source_sentence: 各遠離我，我欲私行。』
translation: Each is far removed from me, and I want to act privately.'

source_sentence: 是時太子，發遣左右，悉令散已，漸至樹下。
translation: The prince then sent his left and right, scattered them all, and gradually went down to the tree.

source_sentence: 到樹下已，即於草上，加趺而坐，諦心思惟眾生有於生老病死種種諸苦，
translation: Having arrived at the foot of that tree, he sat cross-legged on a blade of grass. He thought to himself, “All sentient beings suffer from birth, old age, sickness, and death in various ways.

source_sentence: 發起慈悲，即得心定。
translation: When they give rise to compassion, they'll attain mental concentration.

source_sentence: 彼時即便離於諸慾，棄捨一切諸不善法。
translation: At that point, they'll even part with desires and abandon all unwholesome dharmas.

source_sentence: 思惟境界，分別境界，慾界漏盡，即得初禪。
translation: When he contemplates the objective realm, discerns the objective realm, and ends the contaminants in the desire realm, he attains the first dhyāna.

source_sentence: 『我身亦自有如是法，未免此法，未度此輪。』
translation: 'My body also has such a teaching, but I haven't escaped this teaching and haven't crossed this wheel.'

source_sentence: 當思惟時，有五神仙，飛騰虛空，自在而行，有大威德、有大勢力，具足巧通毘陀之論，
translation: When he thought thus, five holy sages flew up into the sky and traveled freely. They were endowed with great majesty and power and mastered the theories of the Vedas.

source_sentence: 善解諸術，從南向北，經彼園林閻浮樹上，而欲飛過，即不能去。
translation: From the south to the north, he passed through a grove of Jambudvīpa trees and couldn't leave them if he wanted to fly past them.

source_sentence: 各相謂言：『我等往昔，去來自恣穿過須彌，出諸神通，種種示現，乃至到於毘沙門宮大天王所，
translation: Each of them said to the other: In the past, we went and came here freely, crossed the polar mountain, and manifested our supernatural powers in various ways until we reached Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 或至阿羅迦槃多城，亦能穿過彼城，多有種種夜叉諸惡神等，我亦曾經彼上飛過。
translation: I've also been able to pass through the city of Ārakapāṭa, where there are many kinds of yakṣas and bad spirits, and I've also passed by them.

source_sentence: 而此樹端，我亦曾經無量過度，不曾有礙，不失神通。
translation: On the other side of this tree I too have passed beyond measureless distances, never encountering any obstruction or loss of my supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 今日以誰威德力故，令於我等退失神通，不能得過？』
translation: Who is the authoritative power of today that causes us to regress from our supernormal abilities and not attain them?'

source_sentence: 彼等仙人，即觀其樹，遂見太子，在樹陰下，加趺而坐，威光巍巍，顯爀難觀。
translation: Those sages then looked at the tree and saw the prince sitting cross-legged under the shade of a tree. He was so imposing and majestic that it seemed to be difficult to see.

source_sentence: 彼等見已，作是思惟：『此坐是誰？
translation: Seeing this, they thought: Who is this seat?

source_sentence: 將非是彼大梵天王世間之主，或復是彼吃沙那天慾界之主，或天帝釋，
translation: It mustn't be the lord of that great Brahma heavenly king world, or it might be the lord of that sand-eating celestial desire realm, or Indra the ruler of the gods.

source_sentence: 或毘沙門大庫藏主，或月天子，或日天子，或復是於轉輪聖王，或此坐者，
translation: Or the great treasury treasurer Vaiśravaṇa, or the moon goddess, or the sun goddess, or another wheel-turning sage king, or this seated one.

source_sentence: 得非是佛出現世乎？
translation: Is it not the Buddha who appears in the world?

source_sentence: 然今此人，威德甚大。』
translation: Still, this person now has great authority and virtue.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼林守護之神，告諸仙言：『諸仙人輩，此非大梵世間天主，
translation: At that time, the guardian goddess of the forest said to the holy ones, “O holy ones! This is not Brahmā.

source_sentence: 非吃沙那欲界之主，亦非天帝及毘沙門庫藏之主，亦復非是日月天子；
translation: He is neither the ruler of the realm of desire in the realm of food and so on, nor the ruler of the heavenly emperor or the treasury of Vaiśravaṇa. Nor is he a sun and moon god.

source_sentence: 此之太子，名悉達多，是淨飯王，釋種童子。
translation: This prince, named Siddhârtha, is the king of pure rice and a child of the Śākyas.

source_sentence: 諸仙當知！
translation: You should know, sages!

source_sentence: 大梵天王，所有威德，其吃沙那天主、帝釋、毘沙門王庫藏之主，月天日天、轉輪聖王，
translation: The great brahma king of the heavenly kings, endowed with majestic virtue, is the ruler of the sand-eating gods, Indra, Vaiśravaṇa, the treasury lord of the Vaiśravaṇa, the moon god, the sun god, and the universal ruler.

source_sentence: 諸威德等，比悉達多太子所有一毫威德，彼諸威德，十六分中不及其一。
translation: The authoritative qualities and so forth are compared to the one-tiny bit of authoritative qualities that Prince Siddhārtha possesses, and those authoritative qualities aren't one of the sixteen parts.

source_sentence: 是故汝等，至此樹林，欲上飛過，神通有限，不能得度。』
translation: That's why you came to this forest and wanted to fly up there, but your supernormal powers were so limited that you couldn't save them.'

source_sentence: 時彼諸仙，聞護林神如是語已，從虛空下，住太子前，各各說偈，讚歎太子。
translation: When those sages heard these words, the guardian forest gods descended from the sky and stood in front of the prince, each speaking a verse praising him.

source_sentence: 「『世間煩惱火熾然，　　此能出生法池水，
translation: 'The fire of worldly afflictions is blazing, and this can produce the water of the Dharma-bathing pond.

source_sentence: 既得如是微妙法，　　滅彼煩惱火燼無。』
translation: Having attained such a subtle teaching, he extinguishes the fire of those afflictions and burns them away.'

source_sentence: 「『世間愚癡甚黑暗，　　此能出生智慧光，
translation: 'The world's folly is so dark that it can produce the light of wisdom.

source_sentence: 既得如是微妙法，　　照彼昏盲一切世。』
translation: Having attained such a subtle teaching, he illuminates all the worlds of those who are blind.'

source_sentence: 「『憂惱曠野大澤中，　　此大馱乘能勝致，
translation: 'In the great swamp of grief in the wilderness, this great dhāraṇī vehicle can overcome it.

source_sentence: 既得如是微妙法，　　能度三有諸眾生。』
translation: Having attained such a subtle teaching, he's able to save sentient beings in the three existences.'

source_sentence: 「『一切世間煩惱纏，　　此能方便令解脫，
translation: 'All the worldly afflictive bonds of affliction, this can skillfully liberate them.

source_sentence: 既得如是微妙法，　　能脫一切諸結羈。』
translation: Having attained such a subtle teaching, he's able to free himself from all the bonds.'

source_sentence: 「『世間所有生死痾，　　此大醫師能救療，
translation: 'All the world's disputes over birth and death, this great physician can rescue them.

source_sentence: 既得如是微妙法，　　能治一切生死疣。』
translation: Having attained such a subtle teaching, he's able to treat all the warts of birth-and-death.'

source_sentence: 時一仙人，而說偈言：「復有一仙而說偈言：「復有一仙而說偈言：「復有一仙而說偈言：「復有一仙而說偈言：「時諸仙人，
translation: Then another sage spoke these verses: Again, another sage spoke these verses:

source_sentence: 各各說偈歎太子已，接足頂禮，右繞三匝，飛騰虛空，相隨而去。
translation: Each of them spoke a verse in praise of the prince, bowed their heads at his feet, circled him three times to his right, flew up into the sky, and departed.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王須臾之間，不見太子，心內即生不喜不樂，而問人言：『我之太子，
translation: In a moment, King Śuddhodana did not see the prince. With displeasure and displeasure arising from his mind, he asked the people, “O prince!

source_sentence: 今在何處(此上兩句梵本重稱)？
translation: Where is it now (the above two phrases are repeated in the Sanskrit text)?

source_sentence: 忽然不見。』
translation: Suddenly, they don't see it.'

source_sentence: 是時諸臣，東西南北，交橫馳走，尋覓太子，莫知所在。
translation: At that time the ministers, traveling east, west, south, and north in a circular motion, looked for the prince but could not find him.

source_sentence: 時一大臣，遙見太子，在彼閻浮樹陰之下，思惟坐禪，復見一切樹影悉移，
translation: Then one of the ministers saw the prince from a distance, seated under the shade of that Jambudvīpa tree, meditating and sitting in meditation. They also saw the shadows of all the trees all moving away.

source_sentence: 唯閻浮陰獨覆太子。
translation: Only the Jambudvīpa aggregate alone covered the prince.

source_sentence: 時彼大臣，見於太子有是希奇難思議事，即大歡喜，踊躍充遍，不能自勝。
translation: When that minister saw this marvelous and inconceivable thing about the prince, he rejoiced greatly and jumped all over with joy, unable to control himself.

source_sentence: 「『大王太子今在於，　　閻浮樹陰下端坐，
translation: 'Now, prince of kings, the prince is seated at the foot of a tree in Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 加趺思惟入三昧，　　光明照曜如日山。
translation: He enters samādhi with intense contemplation, shining like a mountain of sunlight.

source_sentence: 此實真是大丈夫，　　樹影卓然不移動，
translation: This is really a great man, the shadow of a tree shining brilliantly without moving.

source_sentence: 唯願大王自觀察，　　太子相貌坐云何？
translation: May it please the great king to examine for himself, What's the prince's appearance and seat?

source_sentence: 譬猶大梵諸天王，　　亦如忉利天帝釋，
translation: It's like the great Brahma celestial kings, and it's like the Trāyastriṃśa god Indra.

source_sentence: 威神巍巍光顯爀，　　遍照於彼諸樹林。』
translation: The majestic, majestic, and resplendent light that shines brightly illuminates all those trees and forests.'

source_sentence: 急疾奔馳，走詣王所，至已長跪，依所見事，即說偈言：「時淨飯王聞已，
translation: They rushed to the king’s place and knelt down. Relying on what they saw, they spoke these verses:

source_sentence: 即詣閻浮樹所，遙見太子在彼樹間結加趺坐，譬如黑夜視山頂頭，大聚火光出猛明炎，
translation: He went to the foot of the Jambudvīpa tree and saw from a distance that the prince was sitting cross-legged among the trees. It was as if he were staring at the top of a mountain in the darkness, with the light of a great conflagration shining brightly and blazing brightly.

source_sentence: 盛德顯著炳照巍巍，如重雲間忽出明月，亦如暗室然大淨燈。
translation: It was as if the bright moon were suddenly rising from a heavy cloud and like a great pure lamp in a dark room.

source_sentence: 時王見已，生大希有奇特之心，遍體戰惶，身毛悉竪，即頭頂禮於太子足，
translation: Seeing this sight, the king wondered with great amazement. His body trembled in fear and all his hair stood on end. He bowed at the prince’s feet by touching his forehead to his feet.

source_sentence: 歡喜踊躍，而作是言：『善哉善哉！
translation: Rejoicing and jumping for joy, he said, 'Good, good!'

source_sentence: 我此太子大有威德。』
translation: This prince of mine has great authority and virtue.'

source_sentence: 「『如夜大火聚山頂，　　似秋明月敞雲間，
translation: 'Suppose there's a great fire at night on the top of a mountain, resembling an autumn moon rising in the sky between the clouds.

source_sentence: 今見太子坐思惟，　　不覺毛張身戰慄。』
translation: Now, when I see the prince sitting and contemplating, I don't feel hair standing on my body in fear.'

source_sentence: 「『我今再度屈此身，　　頂禮千輻勝妙足，
translation: 'Now, I bow down again to my body with my head at the feet of a thousand-spoked supremely beautiful legs.

source_sentence: 從生已來至今日，　　忽復得見坐思惟。』
translation: Ever since I was born, I've suddenly been able to see and contemplate it again.'

source_sentence: 說偈讚曰：「時淨飯王說偈讚已，更復頂禮於太子足，重說偈言：「時有擎挾筌蹄小兒，
translation: After King Śuddhodana had praised him in verse, he bowed his head at the prince’s feet and again composed the following verse:

source_sentence: 隨從大王，啾唧戲笑。
translation: They accompanied the great king and chided and laughed.

source_sentence: 至年十九，時淨飯王為於太子，造三時殿：一者暖殿，以擬隆冬；

source_sentence: 第二殿涼，擬於夏暑；

source_sentence: 其第三殿，用擬春秋二時寢息。

source_sentence: 或執牛黃，或執華鬘，或復有執種種雜色微妙衣服，立太子前，常擬供奉。

source_sentence: 其太子父輸頭檀王所著衣裏若迦尸迦，外表則用其餘諸物，太子不然，

source_sentence: 所服之衣，內外悉用迦尸迦。

source_sentence: 作太子左右及執作人、僮僕男女、諸後從等，皆悉餧以粳粮之飯，雜肉韲醬，

source_sentence: 或臛或羹。

translation: The prince’s body was covered with exquisitely fragrant rice and millet, which he stored separately. delicately selected rice and millet were offered to drink in a variety of juices and soups, as well as various kinds of delicacies such as the flavors of all sorts of orchids and aromatic plants.

source_sentence: 及諸餅果。
translation: and the cakes and fruits.

source_sentence: 又持白蓋，覆太子上，或畏夜戲零露風霜，或復晝遊塵埃日照。

translation: He said, 'You relatives!

translation: He'll surely become a wheel-turning sage king, and if he leaves home, he'll surely achieve the unsurpassed path.

source_sentence: 而我等今作何方便，令此童子得不出家？』
translation: What method will we use now to get this boy to leave home?'

source_sentence: 諸釋親族即報王言：『大王！
translation: The Śākyamuni's relatives then reported to the king, saying, 'Great king!

translation: Now, you must quickly build a separate palace for the prince so that the court ladies will have fun and play, and then the prince won't leave home.'

source_sentence: 「『阿私陀所記，　　決定無移動，
translation: 'The Asita's prediction is certain and unmoving,

translation: They won't be deceived by the scattered kings.'

translation: When liberation is not praised as appeasable, it becomes contrary to adversity.

translation: If we were to discuss the matter with the prince, who was deeply attached to it, he would not tell us.

translation: Now, I'm doubtful, what method will I use?'

source_sentence: 復更思惟：『我今可以種種雜寶，作無憂器，持與太子，令太子用施諸女人，

translation: I'll secretly send an envoy to examine his thoughts and look at where the prince's eyes are staring, and I'll marry him as his queen.'

source_sentence: 「時淨飯王即遣造作雜寶玩弄無憂之器，所謂金銀種種雜飾，造已即於迦毘羅城，
translation: King Śuddhodana then ordered that a vessel made of various treasures, such as gold and silver, decorated with various ornaments be produced in the city of Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 振鐸唱言：『從今已去，至七日來，我太子欲見於釋種一切諸女，見已欲施一切雜寶種種玩弄無憂之器，
translation: Zhendatta said, “Seven days from now I wish to see all the daughters of the Śākya clan. Having seen them, I wish to give them all kinds of rare treasures and various playthings that are free from sorrow.

source_sentence: 城內所有一切諸女，悉可來集於我宮門。』
translation: All the women in the city can come and assemble at my palace gate.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，太子六日已過，至第七日，於先出在王宮門前，據筌蹄坐。
translation: “Then on the seventh day, after six days had passed, the prince came out and sat cross-legged in front of the king’s palace gate.

source_sentence: 是時城內一切諸女，皆以種種雜寶瓔珞，各嚴其身，來集宮門，欲見太子，
translation: All the women in the city then came to the door of the palace to see the prince, each adorned with a variety of jewelry.

source_sentence: 復欲受取種種諸寶無憂之器。
translation: They also want to receive and take the various kinds of treasures that are without sorrowful vessels.

source_sentence: 是時太子見諸女來，即持種種寶器，施與彼等諸女，從四方來見太子者。
translation: Seeing the women coming, the prince then took various jeweled vessels and gave them to those women who came from the four directions to see the prince.

source_sentence: 以是太子威德大故，諸女不能正看太子，但取寶器，各各低頭速疾而過。
translation: Because of the prince's great authority and virtue, the women couldn't look at the prince correctly; they simply took the jeweled vessel and passed by, each with their heads bowed and quickly.

source_sentence: 寶器盡已，最後有一婆私吒族釋種大臣摩訶那摩，其女名為耶輸陀羅，
translation: When the treasure vessel had run out, there was finally a minister of the Śākya clan from Vātsīputra named Mahānāma, whose daughter’s name was Yaśodharā.

source_sentence: 前後侍從眾多婢媵，圍遶而來。
translation: The attendants came in front and behind him, surrounded by many maidservants.

source_sentence: 遙見太子，峨峨注睛，舉目雅步，瞻觀直眄，目不斜[門@視]，漸進前趍，
translation: From a distance he saw the prince staring high and low, with his eyes not pointing downward. He raised his eyes to look straight ahead, but gradually stepped forward in front of him.

source_sentence: 來近太子。
translation: They came to the prince.

source_sentence: 如舊相識，曾無愧顏，即白太子，作如是言：『太子！
translation: Knowing the old acquaintance, he once had a shameless countenance and said to the prince, 'Thus, prince!

source_sentence: 今可與我雜寶無憂器來。』
translation: Now, you can give me my miscellaneous treasures and the vessel of no sorrow.'

source_sentence: 太子報言：『汝來既遲，皆悉施盡。』
translation: The prince replied, 'It's late for you to come, so you'll all give alms.'

source_sentence: 彼女復更白太子言：『我有何過？

source_sentence: 汝今欺我不與寶器。』
translation: Now, you've deceived me and won't give me the treasure vessel.'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『我不欺汝，但汝後來，自不及耳。』
translation: The prince answered, 'I won't deceive you; but you will not be able to do so afterwards.'

source_sentence: 是時太子指邊有一所著印環，價直百千，從指脫與耶輸陀羅。
translation: The prince then had a sealed ring at the side of his finger, worth a hundred thousand, that he took off from his finger and gave it to Yaśodharā.

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅白太子言：『我於汝邊可止直於爾許物耶？』
translation: Yaśodharā said to the prince, 'Should I stop at your side and go straight up to these things?'

source_sentence: 太子報言：『我之所著，自餘瓔珞，任意所取。』
translation: The prince replied, 'What's worn by me is the rest of my jewelry, which I can take at will.'

source_sentence: 彼女白言：『我今豈可剝脫太子？
translation: The woman said, 'Shouldn't I now strip off the prince?'

translation: They can only adorn the prince's body.'

translation: After he said these words to the prince, his mind didn't like them, and he returned.

source_sentence: 云何如來在王宮時，將身一切無價瓔珞，脫持施與耶輸陀羅，不能令彼心生歡喜？」
translation: How is it that when the Tathāgata was in the king's palace, he gave Yaśodharā all his priceless jewelry and gave it freely to him so that they wouldn't rejoice in their hearts?

translation: The Buddha addressed Venerable Udāyin, saying, You, Udāyin!

translation: Listen attentively!

source_sentence: 我當說之。
translation: I will explain it.

translation: Even though there are many kinds of rare treasures to give, they still don't rejoice.

source_sentence: 優陀夷言：「甚奇世尊！

translation: What is this matter?

translation: Please explain it for me.

translation: At the time, there was a king who believed in mistaken views and practiced governance.

source_sentence: 彼王有子造少罪愆，父王駈擯令出國界，漸漸行至一天寺中，共婦相隨居停而住。
translation: The king's son committed a minor offense, and his father the king expelled him from the boundary and gradually traveled to a temple where they lived together with their wives and stayed.

translation: The prince then ran out of food, and the prince went hunting to kill and catch all the insects for livelihood.

translation: At the place where he was hunting, he saw a gnawing worm and killed it. He skinned its flesh and boiled it in the water but as it was about to be cooked the juice ran out.

source_sentence: 是時王子語其婦言：『肉未好熟，卿更取水。』
translation: The prince then said to his wife, 'The flesh isn't well cooked; take some water for it.'

source_sentence: 彼王子婦即便取水。
translation: The prince's wife then took the water.

source_sentence: 婦去已後，王子飢急，不能忍耐，即食鼉肉，一切悉盡，不留片殘。
translation: After the queen’s departure, the prince became hungry and unable to bear it. So he ate all of the crocodile meat but did not leave any leftovers.

source_sentence: 時王子婦取水迴還，問其夫言：『此中鼉肉，今在何處？』
translation: The prince's wife then returned with water and asked her husband, 'Where is the meat in this place now?'

source_sentence: 王子報言：『鼉忽然活，今已走去。』
translation: The prince replied, 'The elephant suddenly came back alive, and now it's gone.'

source_sentence: 其婦不信：『何忽如是？

source_sentence: 鼉煮已熟，云何能走？』
translation: How can you walk when the meat is cooked and cooked?'

translation: The woman's mind didn't believe it, but she thought, 'That must be my husband; he's hungry and has run out of food, so he begs me to tell him to leave.'

source_sentence: 情懷瞋恨，心常不歡。
translation: They harbor feelings of anger and resentment, but their minds are always unhappy.

source_sentence: 於後數年，其父命終，時諸大臣即迎王子，灌頂為主。
translation: Several years later, when his father died, the ministers greeted the prince and consecrated him as king.

source_sentence: 既作王訖，所得眾寶，及諸奇珍，種種衣裳，無價之物，皆悉與妃。
translation: Having become king, he gave the queen all the treasures and rare treasures he had obtained, as well as various kinds of clothes and priceless things.

source_sentence: 其妃雖納，而面顏色，不悅如前。
translation: Although the queen accepted it, her countenance and features were not as pleasing as before.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼王語其妃言：『我一切寶，無價之物，以持賜妃，何故顏色，

translation: They won't rejoice, just like the one before?'

translation: They eat meat without leaving anything behind, but they feed on it and say to me, 'Go away.'

translation: The queen then spoke a verse, saying to the king, Tell Udayana, You should know this!

source_sentence: 爾時王者，我身是也；
translation: The king at that time was none other than I myself.

source_sentence: 其王后者，今日耶輸陀羅是也。
translation: The latter king is Yaśodharā today.

source_sentence: 我於爾時，少許犯觸，續於後時，多以財寶，與望和適，而其懷恨，猶不喜歡。
translation: At the time, I'll be touched by a little offense, and when I continue to do so, I'll give it to him with my possessions and hope for peace, but he harbors an angry feeling and doesn't like it.

source_sentence: 今日亦然，雖將無量諸種錢帛，亦不能令其心歡喜。
translation: Even if he were to offer innumerable kinds of money and silk, he wouldn't be able to make them rejoice.

source_sentence: 「時淨飯王所遣密使察太子者，一心覩於太子眼目其所瞻矚，共於諸女相當語對，
translation: At that time, King Śuddhodana had sent a secret envoy to examine the prince. He paid close attention with one mind to what he saw through the prince’s eyes, and exchanged corresponding words with the other maidens.

source_sentence: 而彼密使委悉皆知。
translation: They're all known by the secret messengers and envoys.

source_sentence: 知已即時往詣王所，而白王言：『大王！
translation: Knowing this, he immediately went to the king and said, 'Great king!

translation: “O Mahānāma, you should know that there was a minister of the Sakyans called Mahānāma. That woman later became intimate with the prince and they went back and forth several times, smiling together.

source_sentence: 停住少時，調戲言語。
translation: When he stopped and stayed there for a short time, he regulated his playful speech.

source_sentence: 太子彼女二顏俱悅，彼此答對，四目相當。』
translation: The prince and the woman are both delighted, and they answer each other with their four eyes together.'

source_sentence: 時淨飯王聞彼密觀如是語已，心內思惟：『太子意欲得彼女耶？』
translation: After hearing these words from that esoteric contemplation, King Jīvaka thought in his mind, 'Does the prince want to get a woman?'

source_sentence: 「時淨飯王看好吉宿良善之日，即喚國師婆羅門來，使向釋種摩訶那摩大臣之家，
translation: At that time King Śuddhodana, on the good and auspicious day of the constellation Mahānāma, summoned the brahman teachers of the country to his house.

source_sentence: 而作是言：『知卿有女，今可與我太子作妃。』
translation: He said, 'Know that you have a woman, and now you can give her to my prince as your queen.'

source_sentence: 是時國師聞王語已，即詣釋種摩訶那摩大臣之家，作如是言：『摩訶那摩王勅如是。』
translation: After hearing the king's words, the national teacher then went to the house of the minister Mahānāma of the Śākya clan and said, 'Thus has King Mahānāma instructed me.'

source_sentence: 時釋大臣報國師言：『我釋迦法，相承如是，若有技能勝一切者，於彼人邊即嫁女與；
translation: The ministers of the Śākyamuni then reported to the national teacher, saying: I, the arhat, have inherited the dharma from each other like this. If there is anyone who excels in all abilities, let him marry a woman by their side.

source_sentence: 若無技能，不得與女。
translation: If they don't have the skill, they can't give it to a woman.

source_sentence: 大王太子生長深宮，耽媔嬉戲，未曾學習，無有技能，弓射天文，兵書戎仗，
translation: The prince of the great king grew up in a deep palace and indulged in addictive play. He had never studied or practiced but did not have any skills, such as shooting at celestial objects with a bow or astronomy or writing battle strategies.

source_sentence: 一切戰鬪，捔力拳搥，悉未工閑，我何故今無藝人邊而嫁女與？』
translation: All the battles and fistfights are not yet over, so why wouldn't I marry a woman now if there were no entertainer?'

source_sentence: 「是時國師聞是語已，還至王所，將如是語，具白於王。
translation: After hearing these words, the national teacher returned to the king and reported them to him.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王聞此語已，心懷愁惱，如是思惟：『摩訶那摩此語如法，向我實論無一虛妄。』
translation: After hearing these words, King Śuddhodana was grieved and thus thought, 'This is the teaching of Mahānāma, who really argues to me that there's not a single falsehood.'

source_sentence: 雖作是念，而王內心，悵怏默然迷悶而住，其狀如似坐禪思惟。
translation: Even though he had this thought, the king remained inwardly disheartened and silent, confused and unconscious, looking as if he was sitting meditating or contemplating.

source_sentence: 太子是時，見父王面，失於容色，悵怏不歡，猶如坐禪思惟一種，見是事已，
translation: When the prince saw his father, the king, he looked disheartened and did not rejoice. It was as if he were sitting in meditation contemplating a thought:

source_sentence: 漸至王所，而問王言：『未審父王！
translation: He gradually arrived at the king's place and asked the king, 'I haven't judged my father!

source_sentence: 以何緣故，如是愁惱，獨坐思惟？』
translation: What is the reason for such sorrow and sitting alone contemplating it?'

source_sentence: 作是語已，時淨飯王答太子言：『子不須問我如此事。』
translation: After he said this, King Śuddhodana answered the prince, saying, 'There's no need to ask me about such things.'

source_sentence: 太子再問，父王重止。
translation: The prince asked again, and his father the king stopped again.

source_sentence: 太子如是三問：『父王大王！
translation: The prince thus asked three questions, 'Father, king! Great king!

source_sentence: 要須報我所以，解我心疑。』
translation: It's necessary to repay the reason for my doubt and understand my doubt in my mind.'

source_sentence: 時淨飯王三見太子問如是事，即向太子如前所說。
translation: King Śuddhodana then asked the prince in three ways about these things, and he addressed the prince as before.

source_sentence: 太子知已，問父王言：『父王頗知，父王城內，有人能出與我共試技藝已不？』
translation: Knowing this, the prince asked his father, 'Does your father know?' and he said, 'Is there anyone in my father's city who can come out and test me with him to see if he hasn't?'

source_sentence: 時淨飯王聞此語已，即大歡喜，踊躍遍身，不能自勝，即更重審問於太子，
translation: Having heard these words, King Śuddhodana was greatly delighted and jumped for joy all over his body, unable to control himself. He asked the prince again:

source_sentence: 作如是言：『善哉太子！
translation: He said, 'Good, prince!'

source_sentence: 汝實能捔諸技藝不？』
translation: Can you really see the arts and crafts?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『大王善聽！
translation: The prince answered, 'Great king, listen well!'

source_sentence: 我今實能。
translation: Now, I'm really capable of it.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 但當速集諸釋一切童子，共我捔試諸有技藝。』
translation: You must quickly gather all the children of the Śākyas together with me to test their skills and abilities.'

source_sentence: 「時淨飯王勅迦毘羅城內，街巷四衢道頭，悉教振鐸大聲唱令：『從今以去，
translation: At that time King Śuddhodana instructed the bells and chimes at the four corners of the streets in the city of Kapilavastu to make a loud announcement, saying:

source_sentence: 計至七日，我之儲宮悉達太子，今欲出其所有諸技，若有解者，悉令聚集，
translation: On the seventh day my crown prince Siddhārtha, who is in charge of the palace, wishes to produce all his skills. If he has any understanding, I will cause him to gather them together.

source_sentence: 共捔試看。』
translation: Let's try to see it together.'

source_sentence: 時六日過，至第七日，五百釋種諸童子等，悉達為首，並皆聚集。
translation: On the seventh day, after six days had passed, the five hundred children of the Śākya clan gathered together with Siddhârtha as their leader.

source_sentence: 聚集訖已，相共出城，至一寬地，是諸童子，出技能處。
translation: After they had assembled, they left the city together and went to a wide space where the children came out of their skillful abode.

source_sentence: 時釋大臣即好莊嚴耶輸陀羅，為上勝垛，作如是言：『誰能善通一切技藝，
translation: The ministers of the Śākya clan then adorned the greatly adorned Yaśodharā and built a supreme tower for him, saying: Who is able to master all arts and crafts?

source_sentence: 最勝上者，即以此女與其作妻。』
translation: The most superior one is to give this woman to him as his wife.'

source_sentence: 時淨飯王共諸釋種耆舊長德，於先而至，復有無量無邊雜姓男子女人童男童女，
translation: At that time King Śuddhodana and the other members of the Śākya clan, together with some old men and women of distinguished virtue, came before him. There were also innumerable, limitless, and mixed-gendered men, women, boys, girls, and maidens.

source_sentence: 皆悉聚集，詣彼試場寬地之所，欲觀太子，及諸釋種一切童子，捔試技能，
translation: They all gathered together and went to the wide open space of the test-site, wishing to see the prince and all the children of the Śākya clan how well they could test their skills.

source_sentence: 誰最為勝？
translation: Who is the most superior?

source_sentence: 「是時有諸釋種童子文學快者，先共太子試於手筆，時有釋種，相共謂言：『今者宜令毘奢蜜多為作試師。』
translation: At the time, there were children of the Śākyas who were well versed in literature and had previously tested their handwriting with the prince, and then some of the Śākyas said to each other, 'Now, it's better to make Vaiśravaṇa a testimony.'

source_sentence: 即語之言：『汝可觀察諸童子內手筆誰勝，或復快書疾書善書、解多種書。』
translation: He then said to them, 'You may examine which of the children's palms are superior, or you may quickly write a good book and understand many books.'

source_sentence: 「『一切人間及天上，　　乾闥脩羅迦樓羅，
translation: 'All the people and gods in heaven, as well as the gandharvas, snakes, and garuḍas,

source_sentence: 所有文字諸書典，　　太子遍歷皆通達。
translation: The prince comprehended all the written words and books, And his knowledge pervaded everywhere.

source_sentence: 我身及以汝等輩，　　不知如此書籍名，
translation: I myself and you people do not know the name of such a book.

source_sentence: 人間悉解我試來，　　定知其勝汝不如。』
translation: All the people understand that I've come to test them, and they surely know their superiority and your inferiority.'

source_sentence: 爾時，毘奢蜜多大師先知太子於諸書中最勝最上，熙怡微笑而說偈言：「爾時彼等釋種徒眾，
translation: Knowing that the prince was the foremost among all the books, the great teacher Vaiśravaṇa smiled joyfully and said in verse, It was then that those followers of the Śākya clan

source_sentence: 詳共齊白淨飯王言：『我今已知，大王太子於書典中，最為勝上。
translation: They all said to King Śuddhodana in detail, “I now know that the crown prince of the great king is the most distinguished among the books and scriptures.

source_sentence: 算計須試，得知誰明？』
translation: It's necessary to calculate and test, knowing who will understand it?'

source_sentence: 是時眾中有一最大算計之師，名頞誰那，一切算計最為第一。
translation: At the time, there was one of the greatest arithmetic teachers in the assembly named Kauśinagara, who was the first among all the arithmetic teachers.

source_sentence: 時釋眾喚頞誰那來，將往試驗，語言：『尊者！
translation: The Śākyamunis then called out to Kauṇḍinya, who was about to test him, saying, 'Venerable!'

source_sentence: 汝好觀看諸童子中，是誰算計為最第一？』
translation: Take good care to look around among the children, for whom do you think it's the best?'

source_sentence: 時太子算，令一釋種明了童子對下算籌，而不能供；
translation: The prince then calculated and ordered one of the Śākya clansmen, the boy Prabhākaramitra, to pay the following cheque but he could not make an offering.

source_sentence: 更二童子下，猶不供；
translation: The next two children did not make offerings.

source_sentence: 三童子下，亦不能供；
translation: Even the three children were unable to make offerings.

source_sentence: 乃至一十童子俱下，而亦不供；
translation: Up to ten children were present, but they did not make offerings.

source_sentence: 二十三十、四十五十、一百共下，而亦不供；
translation: Twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, and one hundred in common with each other, but they do not make offerings.

source_sentence: 二百三百、四百五百，一時盡下，猶尚不供。
translation: Twenty-three hundred, four hundred, or five hundred and fifty thousand monks were still unable to pay their respects when the offerings were exhausted.

source_sentence: 是時太子，作如是言：『汝等今算，我當為下。』
translation: The prince then said, 'Now, you'll calculate it as below me.'

source_sentence: 時一釋種童子唱算，太子為下，不能算得。
translation: A boy of the Śākya clan then called out to calculate, but the prince was too small to do so.

source_sentence: 太子復言：『二人雙計。』
translation: The prince then said, 'Two people are both imagining.'

source_sentence: 復不能及。
translation: Again, they can't reach it.

source_sentence: 太子復言：『乃至一百，一時共計。』
translation: The prince then said, 'Up to a hundred, we'll calculate it together at one time.'

source_sentence: 猶不能及。
translation: They still can't reach it.

source_sentence: 太子復言：『汝等何假如是相競，但此等輩，一切一時各自計唱，我當為下。』
translation: The prince then said, 'If you were to compete with each other, but these people would all sing at the same time, and I would be inferior.'

source_sentence: 時諸釋種五百童子，一時俱唱，太子為其一時齊下，如上所數，從於一起，
translation: The five hundred disciples of the Śākya clan all sang together at one time. For the sake of these five hundred disciples, the crown prince equalized and diminished [the number of precepts] for a certain period of time.

source_sentence: 乃至盡數，太子不錯，亦復不亂，安庠審諦，次第而下。
translation: Up to the end of the count, the prince was not mistaken, and neither was he confused. He settled down calmly and deliberately, descending one by one in order.

source_sentence: 彼等一切諸釋童子，盡力共算，不能及逮悉達太子萬分之一。
translation: All of those children of the Śākyamuni could not even calculate by their own power that they would be one-thousandth as numerous as Prince Siddhārtha.

source_sentence: 「『善哉捷利深憶持，　　分明唱下無有錯，
translation: 'Good, zealous and profoundly remembering, there's nothing wrong with clearly singing it down.

source_sentence: 五百釋童稱解算，　　一時共對不能當。
translation: Five hundred children of the Śākyamuni called it a calculation, but they couldn't answer it together at once.

source_sentence: 如是智慧正念心，　　算計疾速甚深奧，
translation: Thus is the mind of wisdom, right mindfulness, calculation, and speed very profound and mysterious.

source_sentence: 是等算師計天下，　　巨海渧數悉應知。
translation: The calculation of the worlds by these masters should be known in terms of vast oceans of numbers.

source_sentence: 汝等默然且禁聲，　　不須與彼相捔競，
translation: All of you, be silent and keep your voices off! Don’t compete with them.

source_sentence: 其既解知如是術，　　應得共我相校量。』
translation: Since they understand and know such a technique, they should be able to evaluate it together with me.'

source_sentence: 時頞誰那國大算師，心密驚怪，極生歡喜，而說偈言：「時彼釋眾一切皆生希有之心，
translation: The great算師誰那國大算師, mysteriously frightened and overjoyed, uttered the following verse with great joy:

source_sentence: 從坐而起，合十指掌，頂禮太子，謂悉達多：『太子大勝，真實大勝。』
translation: He rose from his seat, joined his palms with ten fingers, bowed his head to the prince, and said to Siddhârtha, 'The prince is greatly superior, really greatly superior.'

source_sentence: 同聲復白淨飯王言：『善哉大王！
translation: They all said in unison to King Śuddhodana, Good, great king!

source_sentence: 大得善利！
translation: They'll greatly attain good benefits!

source_sentence: 善生人間。
translation: They'll be well born among humans.

source_sentence: 大王今生如是聰叡大福德子、智慧之子。』
translation: The great king is now born like this, the wise and great son of merit and wisdom.'

source_sentence: 舌根如是，輕便囀滑，成就口業。
translation: The faculty of tongue is like this: when it is light and slippery, verbal action is accomplished.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王熈怡微笑，語太子言：『善哉太子！
translation: King Śuddhodana then smiled and said to the prince, 'Good, prince!'

source_sentence: 汝今能共此頞誰那大算之師，計算世間方便智能，得相入不？』
translation: Now, can you share this with the great arithmetic teacher Vaiśravaṇa, calculate the world's skillful means and wisdom, and enter into each other?'

source_sentence: 是時太子答父王言：『大王我能。』
translation: The prince then answered his father, saying, 'Great king, I can.'

source_sentence: 時淨飯王語太子言：『汝若能者，當自知時。』
translation: King Śuddhodana then said to the prince, 'If you can do so, you should know for yourself when it's time.'

source_sentence: 時頞誰那大計算師語太子言：『仁者太子！
translation: The great calculation master Kauśina then said to the prince, 'Sir, my dear prince!

source_sentence: 汝知億上算數已不？』
translation: Do you know the calculation of the billions?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『我甚知之。』
translation: The prince answered, 'I know it well.'

source_sentence: 時頞誰那算師復言：『汝知云何？
translation: Again, Kauśina then said, 'What do you know?'

source_sentence: 為我說之。』
translation: Explain it for me.'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『凡入億中算計數者，汝等諦聽！
translation: The prince answered, 'All of you who enter into the calculations in the billions, listen closely!'

source_sentence: 我今說之。
translation: I'll explain it now.

source_sentence: 一百百千，是名拘致(隋數千萬)，其百拘致名阿由多(隋數十億)，
translation: One hundred and a hundred thousand [square] koṭis is called ayuta (a yojana in the Sui).

source_sentence: 百阿由多名那由他(隋數千億)，百那由他名波羅由他(隋數十萬億)，
translation: A hundred yojanas are many names of nayutas (thousands of koṭis in the Sui), and a hundred nayutas are called pāraūtas (ten thousand myriads of koṭis in the Sui).

source_sentence: 百波羅由他名[口*恒]迦羅(隋數千萬億)，百[口*恒]迦羅名頻婆羅(隋數十兆)，

translation: The name of a hundred bhikṣus is abhiva ( thousands of myriadstical units; the name of a hundred bhikṣus is vibhāsa).

source_sentence: 百毘婆娑名欝曾伽(隋數千萬兆)，百欝曾伽名婆訶那(隋數十京)，
translation: The one hundred vibhāsākas are called kṣatriyas ( thousands of myriads of koṭis in the Sui), and the one hundred kṣatriyas are called vāhanas ( dozens of cities in the Sui).

source_sentence: 百婆訶那名那伽婆羅(隋數千京)，百那伽婆羅名帝致婆羅(隋數十萬京)，
translation: The name of the one hundred brahmās was Nāgapura ( thousands of cities in the Sui dynasty), and the name of the one hundred brahmās was Tiṣyapura (hundreds of thousands of cities in the Sui dynasty).

source_sentence: 百帝致婆羅名卑婆娑他那波若帝(隋數千萬京)，百卑婆娑他那波若帝名醯兜奚羅(隋數十姟)，
translation: The name of the hundred emperors and patriarchs was Upāsatanapājñāpāramitā ( thousands of myriads of koṭis in the Sui dynasty), and the name of the hundred upāsaṇapājñāpāramitā was Hepuśara ( dozens of eons in the Sui dynasty).

source_sentence: 百醯兜奚羅名迦羅逋多(隋數千姟)，百迦羅逋多名醯都因陀羅陀(隋數十萬姟)，
translation: The name of Baekhyetukhīra is Kālāgupta ( thousands of koṭis in the Sui dynasty), and the name of Baekhyetukhīra is Ketu Indra ( billions of koṭis in the Sui dynasty).

source_sentence: 百醯都因陀羅陀名三蔓多羅婆(隋數千萬姟)，百三蔓多羅婆名伽那那伽尼多(隋數十秭)，
translation: The name Sanskrit is derived from the Sanskrit saṃmantaka (a thousand yojanas in the Sui dynasty).

source_sentence: 百伽那那伽尼多名尼摩羅闍(隋數千秭)，百尼摩羅闍名目陀婆羅(隋數十萬秭)，
translation: Hundreds of thousands of nuns and nuns (Skt. mahoraga) were the names of a hundred nuns and nuns called mudrakara (Skt. mahoraga).

source_sentence: 百目陀婆羅名阿伽目陀(隋數千萬秭)，百阿伽目陀名薩婆婆羅(隋數十壤)，
translation: The name of the one hundred agadas is Agama-mudrā, and the name of the one hundred agadas is sarvara.

source_sentence: 百薩婆婆羅名毘薩闍波帝(隋數千壤)，百毘薩闍波帝名薩婆薩若(隋數十萬壤)，
translation: The name of one hundred sarvasattvas is called viṣyapāda ( thousands of yojanas in the Sui), and the name of one hundred sarvasattvas is sarvajña (hundreds of thousands of yojanas in the Sui).

source_sentence: 百薩婆薩若名毘浮登伽摩(隋數千萬壤)，百毘浮登伽摩名婆羅極叉(隋數十溝)，
translation: The name of the one hundred sarvasattvas is uposatha (in Chinese: ), and the name of the one hundred uposathas is uposatha.

source_sentence: 入於如是算計之數，其須彌山若欲算知斤兩銖分，悉可得知。
translation: If he enters into such a calculation, the amount of Sumeru's mountain can be fully known if he wants to calculate it as a pound or two pieces of gold.

source_sentence: 自此已上，復有一算，名陀婆闍伽尼民那，此之已上，復有算計，名奢槃尼，
translation: Above this, there is another set of calculations called Duvājakaṇi-minṇa. Above this, there is another set of calculations called Śākyamuni:

source_sentence: 此尼已上，復有算名波羅那陀，此上復有算名伊吒，此上復有算名迦樓沙吒啤多，
translation: Above this nun, there's another calculated name named Vārāṇasī; above that, there's another calculated name Īṭa; above that, there's another calculated name Kālôdayiṣṭhapāda.

source_sentence: 此上復有算名薩婆尼差波。
translation: Here, there's another calculation that calls it sarvaṇi-paripṛcchā.

source_sentence: 至於此計恒河沙等，一切算數，總覽盡收。
translation: As for these calculations of the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River, all the calculations are collected in a comprehensive way.

source_sentence: 此上復有算計數，名阿伽娑婆，此數數於一恒河沙億百千萬恒河沙數，
translation: Again, there is another kind of calculation at the top of this mountain called āga-svāda. These numbers are as numerous as the number of grains of sand in one Ganges River that are one hundred million and a hundred thousand times the number of grains of sand in one Ganges River.
